text: Bottle. Pours a near clear dull gold with a white head that dissipates nearly completely. Aroma has a decent amount of tropical fruits and citrus with some light grains backing. Flavor has notes of funky tropical fruits and citrus with a light sweet grain backbone.
Pours hazy golden with a one finger high white head. Aroma; Grapefruit, lemon, citrus, floral and minerals. Taste; Grapfruit, citruss, minerals, some pine and herbs.

(Karl Strauss Mosaic Session IPA) Bottle 355ml at home as Mosai Session Ale, served into a shaker, ABV 5.5%
Orange colour on the body, tall and frothy white head on top.
Aroma of citrus, lemon flowers, tropical fruits.
Taste is very citrusy, lemmon flowers, lemon leaves, a touch of tropical fruits, pine.
Medium thin body, very dry on the palate.
Quite good.

UPDATED: MAY 22, 2017 风格：Session IPA
酒精度：5.5%vol
 一款Mosaic单一酒! IPA，相比大开大 IPA，这款在各方
Im just not a fan of session ipas, still this is pretty good. Aroma is juicy grapefruit a hint of resin. Flavor is like nose, balanced, but with modern alcohol a bit flat.

De cervecería Karl Strauss(E.U.A) esta Session IPA de nombre Mosaic Session IPA debido a que es una single Hop que solo contiene lúpulo americano Mosaic, muy popular en estas épocas en la elaboración de estilos lupulados, al ser una Session solo contiene 5.5% ABV y 45 IBUs de amargor.
En apariencia tiene una corona de espuma delgada de aspecto blanquecino, baja actividad de carbonatación, perlas compactas, el liquido tiene ronda colores del pajizo a el amarillo claro con turbiedad, cuerpo ligero.
Muy aromatica desde el momento en que se libera, cítricos marcados como toronja y cascara de naranja, ligeramente pinácea, no destaca la malta pero el lúpulo esta muy bien aprovechado, sencilla y al mismo tiempo bien delimitada cumpliendo la finalidad de una single hop.
De inicio es muy refrescante, el cuerpo ligero resalta este elemento, el amargor es medio, se pueden percibir sabores a cascara de naranja, toronja, herbal y pinácea en un grado bajo, fácil de digerir con un retrogusto hacia lo cítrico, muy bien lograda y cumplidora con lo esperado, tanto que tiene una calificación de en estilo 99 y en el general 97 en Ratebeer.com.
Bottle. It was good but not overwhelming. Mid/high bitterness. Grapefruit, herbal flavour
Bottle. Tropical and citrus fruit aroma. Light refreshing tropical fruit and grape taste. Good.

Avis personnel lune des meilleurs session ipa que jai pu goûté, ça sent les fruits exotiques cest dun jaune orangé doré magique le gout est au niveau des espoirs attendu soit très fruité le palais est frais et désaltérant. Bref au top!
Bottle. Not sure what the hype is all about. This needs to be near room temperature to have any hop character. Eventually some tropical fruit comes through but really just a bitter fart water.

On tap at Karl Strauss, pours a clear blonde with a small white head. Aroma brings out dank, herbal hops, some pot and toasted biscuity malt. Flavour is very dry, with earthy, herbal hops upfront and backed with dry biscuity malt to back. Nice balance but nothing special.

Clear yellow with a bright white head and modest lace. Aromas of grapefruit and modest pine. Bitterness up front with a pleasant biscuity malt sweetness for support. Light body, lively carbonation, watery mouthfeel and a crisp finish.
On tap at Karl Strauss Downtown, San Diego. Golden with a white head. Fresh and hoppy with citrus, peach and some malt. The finish was fairly bitter.

330ml bottle
Pale gold with great two fingers head.
Fruity aroma - grapefruit, mango and pineapple.
Mild bitterness with juicy hop body/finish.
Decent.

Fľaa od minipivovar.sk. Zlatá farba, biela pena. Vôňa sladová, citrusová, grapefruitová, ivica, chmeľ. Chuť sladová, jemne trávnatá, citrus a grapefruit. Dochuť horká, dlhá, jemne ivica. Plné telo, vyia nasýtenosť. Veľmi príjemné a super piteľné.
On tap at the brewery. Pours a clear yellow gold with thick creamy white head that lasts. The aroma is dank and blueberry. Medium body, juicy, grass, melon, blueberry, light bitterness, very good.

Pours a clear golden yellow on tap with fluffy white head that dissipates to leave good lace. Aroma of big resinous fruity hop notes over a hint of pale malt. Taste follows, awesome hop notes, low bitterness, really easy drinker. Awesome.

Robe blonde orangée légerement trouble surmontée dune belle mousse blanche qui évoque à lapparence une bonne bière fraîche aux arômes tropicaux. Le nez va directement dans ce sens avec les agrumes (pamplemousse), les fruits tropicaux, un petit côté citrus et un houblon bien présent. En bouche on a une amertume houblonnée très séduisante et bien gérée, un bon côté fruit tropical, le tout assez proche du nez au final. Une vrai réussite que je recommande fortement!

De un bonito color dorado y rematada con una tupida corona de espuma blanca que no persiste demasiado. Su aroma es simplemente bestial. Estoy por decir que es de esas cervezas que incluso huelen mejor que saben. Es pegar una esnifada y los cítricos y las frutas tropicales lo inundan todo: naranja, pomelo, piña parece mentira que una monovarietal pueda desplegar un abanico de sensaciones tan impresionante.

En boca no mantiene el nivel de su aroma, Los cítricos siguen siendo los protagonistas y un cierto carácter amargo y seco, aunque no sé muy bien como lo consiguen pero el conjunto es de lo más refrescante. Una cerveza fresca, de trago largo, de esas que entran solas.

Mosaic Session IPA doesnt have as low of an ABV as some of the increasingly lightweight yet heavily hopped beers on the market, but with flavor like this, how can you complain? The nose has everything you could want from Mosaic - grass, cannabis, passion fruit, papaya, grapefruit, and tangerine. Herbal, floral, and fruity flavors. There is some resinous bitterness but also some mouth-watering juicy, sweet characteristics of berry, melon, and gummy candy. The chewy body would never make you think "session ale" and thats a great thing. This is one tasty tropical IPA.
equilibrio, lupulo, magica session ipa, de cuerpo medio y sabor muy fino, muy bien hecha

Fajna piana o slimakowym wykonczeniu, trwala do konca degustacji. Jasna barwa leciutko metna. Zapach zepsutego melona i zielonego grejfruta. Piwo w smaku goryczkowe wytrawne malo slodkie a przy tym delikatne i lekkie. Dominuja ciagle smaki cytrusowe na czele grejfruty zielone i niedojrzale ananasy. Super pijalne

Draft @ Karl Strauss Brewing Company - San Diego (Downtown), San Diego, CA. Pours a slightly hazy golden color with a small white head. Has a fruity malty peachy hoppy aroma. Fruity malty peachy hoppy citrus flavor. Has a fruity malty peachy hoppy citrus finish.
Different kinds of aroma from mosaic hop and light body with small bubble head. Great overall.

Amsterdam Pubcrawl 2016, @Tap Zuid, van fles, donker gouden met volle witte kraag. aroma van citrus, tropisch fruit, gist en wat mout, sinaasappel,gras, stro, iets paarden funckyness oid. Smaken zijn matig bitter, gras, stro, hooi, dun van textuur, redelijk veel mondvullende co2, sinaasappel, gist, droge afdronk.
Bottle. Golden blonde. Herbal, fruity aroma. Citric flavor. Soft herbal notes. Floral. Pleasant.
Sampled at Tap Zuid, Amsterdam. Lightly hazy yellow golden color, medium sized white head. Smell and taste lightly malts, grassy, grassy hops, lightly bitter. Decent body and carbonation. Nice.
Bottle at Tap Zuid during pubcrawl. Hazy golden with white head. Doughy yeasty smell. Sweet malts, dank marijuana, passion fruit. Medium sweet and bitter. Creamy feel, medium body. Yeasty finish.
Bottle at Tap Zuid. Hazy light golden with white head. Light lime, mango and quite some pineapple. Dry dusty malts, a touch of flowers. Light sweet and just medium bitter. Under medium bodied.

35cl Bottle at Tap Zuid. Hazy golden yellow colour, white head. Aroma is floral, blossom, citrus, melon. Flavour is light to medium sweet, fruity, melon, citrus, light floral, bitter finish. Light bodied. OK.

33cl bottle shared at tap zuid. 
Thick creamy white head. Very hazy blond pour. Nice bitterness.
Bottle from World Market. Somewhat sweet hop flavors up front with a little bit of graniness. Decent hop character with a nice malt backbone.

0,355l bottle at home bougth at Firmabier. No BB date. As "Karl Strauss Mosaic Session Ale". yellow almost clear color, small white head. smells rather zesty but very muted of grapefruit, berry notes, raspberries. not much else. good smell overall. light to medium body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes lightly citric, some zest, some herbs, spices, malty. finishes lightly bitter with some citric and zesty notes. hmm, both taste and smell are very muted, even rather malty (for a session ipa?), I believe this might be rather old. The neck says "11:16 0146" (which I assume does not mean BB 11/16). anyway, had better.

From a bottle into a 2016 New Belgium stem glass. Pours gold with head and lace. Aroma of grains, hay, cut wood, pineapple, sweet strawberry and watermelon. Significant carbonation and mouthfeel. Flavors of amber malts, straw hops, hay, subtle strawberry jam, minerals, oats. Overall a uniquely lovely smelling and good tasting West coast session IPA.

Draft at Tender Greens SD with lunch. Hazy yellow color with a thin white head and sreams of bubbles. The aroma is lemony citrus with a hint of oranges. Flavor starts a little sweet with mandarin oranges but finishes with light bitterness. Enjoyable and sessionable.

5.5%ABV. Mosaic.

Poured out yellow. 4ºSRM.

Nose is cat piss but invitingly sour. Citrus peel with grapefruit comes to mind. Some light pine.

Mouthfeel is carbonated. Palate is spicy. Cilantro and fennel seeds. Middle has some broad minerality as well.

Finish is brief and bitter with herbaceous freshness.

Light, tasty, interesting. Just not lists material for me.

12oz bottle from Plumpjack Noe Valley. Clear bright golden color but the bubbz are a little large for my tastes. Great aroma, a touch of honey malt with big citrus, tropical, and earthy hop notes. Really excellent flavor with a restrained sugary malt backbone and substantial hop punch. Palate is crisp, maybe just a tad watery. "Session Ale" at 5.5% - riiiiiight - any British person would skewer them for claiming that. But anyway a really nice lighter IPA.
Draft at KS in San Diego. Golden, mostly clear with a lacing head. Hoppy and citrusy. Nicely balanced finish.

As Karl Strauss Mosaic Session Ale. An ISA highlighting the Mosaic hop variety, derived from Simcoe. Very regular, egg-white, densely moussy, creamy head remaining completely closed for most of the time, sustained by fierce but fine, champagne-like sparkling within the clear, deep warm old gold coloured beer underneath, turning more deeply yellowish and equally hazy with sediment added. Lovely fragrant aroma of lime peel, yellow grapefruit, lemon blossom, freshly grated ginger, green banana, starfruit, sourdough, unripe melon, zucchini, dry dust (dusty dried flowers), dried wormwood, white pepper. Crisp flavor, fruity elements in a subdued but elegant way combining a very restrained sweetishness of green banana with an equally restrained sourishness of kiwi and starfruit, refined carbonation tingling a bit but not numbing and perfectly fit for the style, supple and lightly bready maltiness in the middle, bit cookie-like but in a very subtle, non-sweet way, lightly resinous hop finish, pleasantly bittering but mildly so, yet long and aromatic, dry, with peppery and grapefruity notes, even a light hint of pine retronasally. Light, crisp, elegant and extremely thirst quenching: this is an exemplary session IPA by all means, even among the best in this specific young substyle I had so far. But I hadnt expected anything less from this brewery either...

Vraiment excellente.
Nez assez résineux, vert, fond de mangue, ananas. On croirait une double IPA.
Bouche à lattaque très aromatique, résineuse, verte, un fond ananas. Très équilibrée.
Finale peu amère, sèche.

Pours a pale gold color with a white head. Citrus, floral, hop and biscuit aroma. Grapefruit, tangerine, tropical fruit, floral and biscuit flavors. Light body and average carbonation with a citrus hop finish.
Fabulosa cerveza, de las mejores en su estilo. Sabor cítrico resinoso y perdura en el paladar.

12 fl oz bottle from Saveur Biere. Pours a yellow gold colour with a white foam head leaving some lacing and hoppy fruity orange & grapefruit citrus aroma. Flavour is malt caramel, alittle biscuit, with peach, citrus, pine, hop resins and grapefruit bitterness. Light bodied, soft carbonation, dry tangy dusty bitter finish. Very drinkable session IPA.
Cloudy, dull tan. Thin head. Light pale malt, light lemony hop, has a nice refreshing character.

12fl oz bottle. 28-08-2015.
Courtesy of Javiificould.
BBD:04-2016.
Pours clear golden with nice off whie head. Short head retenion, little lacing. Mild bitter, fruity, grassy.
From XXXII. In Teku glass. After dinner. Body, bittermess and fruityness at perfect levels, in both mouth and nose. What envy give me those yankies that can have easy access to it!

Poured from a can. Pale gold with a nice white head. Good lacing. Fruity aroma. Nice and crisp. Piney. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Mosaic Session Ale est une succulente India Pale Ale brassée par Karl Strauss aux États-Unis. Une IPA qui comme son nom l’indique est chargée en houblon Mosaic.
Cette bière s’orne d’une robe dorée pâle dominée par une tête blanche crémeuse avec une bonne rétention dans le verre.
Olfactivement, elle développe des arômes richement fruités apportant des parfums qui mettent l’eau à la bouche : pomme, mangue, agrumes, raisin et un peu de pêche et d’ananas.
Gustativement, elle dévoile tout son potentiel houblonné et floral avec des saveurs de fruits tropicaux, d’agrumes, de pins et des notes plus légères de caramel. Pour une IPA on peut noter que son amertume est assez douce.

Cristal clear, pale golden color. Three fingers white head, not very persistant, nice lacing. Awesome in aroma. Amaizingly fresh, fruity, citrusy and a bit nafty. Crisp, suggests such a nice and refreshing beer. Unfortunately the aroma is much better than taste. Taste seems to be flat, not that juicy, not that full of flavours as it might be jugging by the aroma. It still is very crisp, very drinkable but its just too watery in taste, too easy on the taste. Its like hidden somewhere. Tiny bitterness in the back end, and in the afterstaste is super pleasant though. Good refreshing mouth feel. Good beer, but I had much bigger expectations.
Bottle. Hazy golden color with white head. Aroma is mosaic blueberry, some sweatsocks, nice tropical fruits. Taste is slightly buttery, oniony, more perfumed hops. Light-bodied. Good modern Pale Ale.

Bottle at Beer Temple, pours clearish golden with large and frothy white head. Mouthfeel is very light sikiloar to a lager. Notes of toasted Malt, light spice, somewhat citrus hop but hard to distinguish. Too thin and bland

Bottle. Shaker. Golden, little hazy with medium, white head. Poor head retention and lacing. Citrus and tropical fruits aroma, not so intense rather dull and light. Taste is the same from lightly to medium bitter, esp. in the end, light grainy aroma. Ligh to medium body, average carbonation in the beginning lively, finish is lighlty bitter. In overall a little be overated, nothing that koncked me down, ok its highly drinkable, but nothing special about it.

Bottle, 355ml. Clear golden with a frothy offwhite head. Fruity hoppy aroma, hints of resin, tropical fruits, caramel. Medium bodied with moderate carbonation. Thin and astringent. Medium sweet citrus character with a medium to heavy bitter hoppiness. Excellent, I could drink 8 of these.

Bottle, 355ml. A clear golden beer with a medium white head. Aroma is of hops, citrics, grapefruit and a hint of pine. Taste is bitter with a hoppy finish. Light to medium bodied with some carbonation and astringency. Very well-balanced with a medium finish and very drinkable.
So aromatic. Mangos, pineapple and huge citrus. Best mouth feel of a session. That has to come from the admittedly higher abv. Taste, tropical more mango more grapefruit. Damn good beer!

Botte at home. As "Karl Strauss Mosaic Session Ale". Aroma is tons of tropical fruity hops, citrus, grapefruit, pine resin. Flavour is lightly sweet and moderate to medium bitter. Body is medium. Exquisite fruity hoppy Session IPA, very easy and refreshing yet aromatic.
On tap. Poured a golden color with an averaged sized head. Citrus, pine and some toast.

Tropical fruit dominate the aroma with an extra dimension that smells almost like a fresh hopped beer. Aroma doesnt stick around. Taste is same with light pine, body is quite light. Simple but tasty.

blonde dorée, beau col de mousse blanche qui disparait doucement. Nez très agréablement fruité : citron, fruits tropicaux, mangue. La bouche est à la mesure du nez, on retrouve les mêmes saveurs, on profite à plein du généreux houblonnage en mosaic. Le corps est assez aqueux (normal pour le style), la carbo très bonne, lamertume est présente mais pas si prononcée. Superbe bière rafraichissante, laissant pleinement sexprimer le mosaic !

354ml bottle at Beer Station, Xiamen. Labelled as Mosaic Session Ale but I guess it is the same. Pours hazy yellow with a thin white head. Aroma of tropical fruit and hops. Bitter finish. A little thin but pretty decent.

Bottle @ Beer Temple, shared with Abijen & MarcodL. Golden color, slightly hazy. White head, not much. Aromas: full on tropical fruit. Additionally some resin and grains retronasal. Flavor is refreshingly moderate bitter with some grain. Nice!

12 oz bottle. From demolenbeershop.com.
Cloudy yellow golden color with a small frothy white head. 
Citrusy, grapefruity and fruity hoppy aroma with full of freshness and mild bitterness. Yummy! The flavor is citrusy and grapefruity hoppy with mildish bitterness, dryness and some maltiness. Balanced and tasty. A very nice Session IPA. No freshness info in the bottle but seems to be reasonably fresh.
Tap at San Diego airport. Mostly clear light orange pour with a foamy white head. Nice tropical fruit aroma and taste. Light and bright, very thirst quenching and easy to drink.

Bottle from USN Mini Mart in Japan. Citrus, spruce on the nose. Golden, frothy appearance. Salty, lightly bitter, light body. Agree that the dry-hopping makes this beer much hoppier than expected for a pale ale. Excellent work.

Bottle at beertemple. Golden pour. Nice aroma of citrus, tropical fruit and bitter grain. Great taste of fresh hops, tropical fruit, mango, mild peach and some caramel. Very tasty, this is how mosaic should be used.
Goud oranje onhelder bier met een kleine witte schuim kraag. Ruikt fruitig, tropisch fruit, mango, limonade. Smaakt bitter, fruitig, mango.

Bottle at home. Hazy golden pour, thin white head. Aroma of fruity hops, citrus, somewhat floral and a hint of resin. Flavor is quite bitter, fruity and refreshing. A bit thin, but clean and well drinkable. Nice.

Cervesa amb bon aroma, però molt descompensat si ho comparem amb el gust.
Cerveza con buen aroma, pero muy descompensado si lo comparamos con el sabor.

Lovely nose of overripe peach, papaya, pineapple. More bitter on the palate, but still rich tropical hops all the way, notes of fresh pine, a tad astringent on the finish. Gets better as it warms but a little bit on the bitter side for me, still a pretty decent mosaic ale.

Bomber (during the Super Bowl 2016). Moderate, but definite, Mosaic nose, citrus, and light dank quality. Pale straw color. Breads initial, sudden citrusy attack, lots of grapefruit and some pineapple. Mosaic controls the palate throughout. Wow! A nice surprise from this brewery. Quite good.
Una cerveza excelente, ligera, lupulada, refrescante, equilibrada y que apetece beber siempre en cualquier momento.

Draft at Springers tap room Santa rosa. Clear golden yellow coloured pour with a fine sticky white head that lasts. Aroma is nice mixed bag of fruits, tropical fruit salad, mango, hint of grains, and grass. Flavour is composed of light grains, light grassy, tropical fruit, orange and mango. Palate is light, semi sweet, light grains, moderate carbonation. Pretty drinkable.

Sampled May 2015
A steady pour into my IPA glass produces a three finger thick, pale, off-white colored head. The beer is a light golden color that shows a brilliantly clear, bright gold hue when held up to the light. The aroma smells down-right juicy with tones of tropical hop fruit character; lychee, guava, some kumquat zest, spicy tropical fruit notes, and super floral tropical notes, as well as an almost dank leaning, overly ripe fruit character that is hard for me to describe.

Light bodied, but has enough viscosity to not come off as overly thin with all the hop character, there is also a nicely effervescent carbonation here that provides some texture, and an additional bit in the finish along with the firm, hop bitterness. The hop fruit character dominates this beer with flavors of lychee, guava, gooseberries, and something that I want to describe as spicy mango, with grassy herbal notes. There is just a touch of malt character, it suggests at pale malt cracker like notes, and perhaps a touch of sun-baked straw, but really this beer is about the hops. Meyer lemon zest, some floral / ripe tangelo zest notes, and even a touch of grapefruit add some citrus layers to the hop fruit character. 

This is a really good Session IPA, I would happily drink a whole lot of this if it was fresh.

Bottle at La Fine Mousse Restaurant, Paris.
Quite surprising to state its a session IPA at 5.5%, but I guess thats the trend... Bright orange with a timid, white head. Very citrusy (lemon and tangy grapefruit) with a relatively clean and dry finish. Medium to full bodied. Quite enjoyable!
Tap, gold pour, white head, nose is citrus, taste is oranges, lemons, hops, bitter, pretty good session
On tap @ the brewery, downtown San Diego location. Clear light golden hue, low white head. Bright fresh passion fruit character, lean crackery malts, moderately bitter finish.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Bottle from Terre de Boissons Calais and drunk at home. Clear gold no real head. Orangey pungent Mosaic hop aroma. Oooh thats lovely. Love the orange and satsuma and tangerine fruits. Over carbonated. Long finish. Just tons of fruit. Really good. First rate of 2016 and I hope I have many others as good if not better than this.

New Year Bottle Share in Odense. Hazy golden with a lasting white head. Fruity hop aroma with grapefruit, lime and peach. Dry and very fruity flavour with citrus especially. A little unusual for a Mosaic single hop, and in a good way

Bottleshare @ Rekviums Pizza Palace, Odense C. My fifteen thousand party bash. Pours hazy yellow with a white head. Had 5-7 Karl S beers last year and all was poor. This is really delicious. Freshly hopped mosaic. Grassy, and citrussy. Dry and bitter finish. Nice.

Bottle at a average bottle shares prol edition. Pours yellow with a white head. Aroma of thistle, juicy, orange, peppery notes, soapy. Taste is hopward, juicy, light malts, light body. Extreme drinkability quite dank.

From bottle at Average Bottlesharers Prollede Smagning. Pours almost clear golden with a white head. Aroma of mosaic, juicy, tropical, pineapple, peaches. Taste is tropical, fresh, citrus, peachy, light bitter finish. A bit watery, tastes more like 4%.

[ bottle ][ 1.5oz ][ @Tasting ][ $ ? ][ schnapps flute ][ 12.20.15 ]hazy gold, puffy white, dies quickly. Dusty dank lime nose, softly paper, moderate melon sweetness distracts. Front palate is simple orange rind, muted with light stable, low sweetness until mid, lightly oily throughout with sticky end.
12oz can pours a clear gold with some spitty, white head. Nose has grass and fresh cream, mild perfume, mild fruit. Flavor has light malt and grass, some guava, some herbs. Slick finish.

Bottle at the main DC December gathering. Poured a hazy orange color with a small off-white head. Aroma was solid tropical notes. Lot of orange and tasty citrus. Almost totally sessionable, with a solid flavor.
Citrus and some light pine. Pours hazy orange with good head and lacing. Decently bitter finish. Can shared at tasting.
Can at the DC December Gathering #2. Hazy yellow with off-white head. Aromas of tropical and stone fruit, some floral notes. Tastes of citrus, tropical fruit, floral. Medium body with a dry finish.
From a can at the Ratebeer Dec 22 gathering 2015. Pours a clear pale gold with an off white head. Fruity nose. Flavors of citrus and grass. Bitter finish.
Can. Clear golden yellow color. Earthy citrus aroma. Taste is dank lemon. Tasty.

Bottle 35,5cl / Botella 35,5cl.
@ XXXII, Sevilla, España.
A: Golden / Dorado.
T/S: Hops, citrusy, fruity / Lupulo, citrico, afrutado.

Bottled. Pours slightly hazy golden with an average off-white head. Aroma of citrus, lime zest, tropical fruit, caramel and pine. Sweet flavor that ends up dry and pleasant bitter. Medium bodied, oily texture and soft carbonation. A very nice SIPA.🌟🌟🌟🌟

De color dorado con suave espuma blanca con bastante persistencia.
Aroma principalmente a cítricos y algo de piña.
De cuerpo ligera y carbonatación media.
En boca suave amargor a cascara de naranja.
Muy equilibrada, para beber por litros.

UPDATED: DEC 15, 2015 Slightly hazy orange color with white head. Fresh hoppy aroma with citrus fruits. Taste is also nice and fruity with a bit of dankness but mostly fresh and fruity. Body is crisp and slightly mineral. For a session IPA its quite tasty.

Golden color with a white head, medium duration. Aroma has notes of tropical fruits, some pineapple and resin hops. Flavor is mild bittery with good duration, very fresh mouthfeel with fruity notes on palate. Very enjoyable....

Botella, @Rosses i Torrades - celler de cerveses, Barcelona. 16/11/2015. BBD: 08/2016
Color amarillo transparente, aroma frutal, cuerpo ligero.

33 cl bottle @ home. Clear blonde beer with a big, white head, bit adhesive. Aroma is citrus, peaches, mango. Taste is sweet, fruity, peaches, caramel, bit hoppy. Aftertaste is pine, bitter-sweet, dry.

3/X/15 - 33cl bottle from Geers (Oostakker) @ home - BB: 30/XI/15 (2015-1441) 
Clear yellow blond beer, creamy solid off-white head, stable, adhesive, leaving some lacing in the glass. aroma: sweet, peaches, fruity, some exotic fruits, bit of citrus. MF: soft carbon, medium to light body. Taste: fruity start, peaches, bit sweet, pretty bitter, some caramel. Aftertaste: soft fruitiness, bit grassy, dry, bitter, some citrus. Very nice one!
Yellow colour, white head. Aroma of tropical fruits and candy sugar. Taste is light to medium bitter, light body, thin texture, average carbonation.

Can. 12-ish cans over the course of two days, most just straight from the can, but a handful poured into a glass. Clear gold with a white head. Fruity hops, mild-moderate bitterness, some grassy notes, and a quick dank hoppy finish. Super sessionable.

bottle at home. bought at hour local bottle shop. exported to the netherlands. poured a slight cloudy light pale yellow colour with a small white head on top. nose is loaded with fresh juicy fruits, with a small notice of crisp malts, and grains. real sweet tropical fruits. mango flesh, and a note of pineapple. freshly cut grass and a slight zesty note. lots of citrus aswell. wow this is so good! so refreshing and full flavoured! i would love to drink this everyday!

6th October 2015Bright clear pale gold beer, good pale cream colour head. Palate is light and crispy. Very light pale malts, mildly sweet. Hops bring modest pine and mild skunk. A little passion fruit emerges before citric peel bitterness takes over. Light finish. Clean and drinkable.
12 fl.oz bottle. Pours clear golden colour with a huge good lasting white head. Aroma of fresh hops, peach, melon. Taste is very hoppy, intense bitter, fresh hops, citrus, grass, melon, delicious!
Tap. Pours clear golden, large white head, nice lacing. Aroma is tropical, passionfruit, melon, hints of pot. Flavor is very light sweet, light bitter, fruity and juicy. Light body.

22 oz bomber from whole foods SB. Pours clear yellow that becomes more cloudy as it warms up. Fresh hop aroma upon bottle opening . Fresh fruit-filled hop flavor that blossoms as it warms. At 5.5 Abv this is a much more flavorful session IPA than the 4-5% ers that tend to be overly dry and harsh . This session beer actually tops more fuller bodied Brews and I can see why it won GABF bronze for a session ale. Delicious and highly recommended 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

355ml bottle. Clear, orangey, pale golden colour with average, frothy, fairly lasting, minimally lacing, white head. Gigantic citrusy hoppy, tropical fruity aroma, notes of grapefruit, mango, passion fruit, some pineapple, orange zest, marmalade. Taste is slightly sweet pale malty, fruity, citrusy hoppy overtones, notes of mango, grapefruit and lemon tend to become slightly mineral in the finish. Superb Session Ale - obligatory for every Mosaic lover.
12FL OZ ($12 6/pack) fell far short of any hype. 5.5% abv is just far too low to make a dent. taste was good but over priced as always with karl strauss.

Bottle pour. Pale straw with little head, massive grapefruit hop aroma. Moderate bitterness, grapefruit strongest,  pine and grass hop aroma. excellent session IPA, (or with this this subtle malt, is it a hopped up APA?) impressive from KS.
One of the sleeper gems of my trip to California. Has all the nice things you expect from Mosaic with the fruitiness and some garlicky notes. Very good.

Cask @ Karl Strauss La Jolla, San Diego, CA 

Pours yellowish orange with a smooth head. Aroma of juicy fruits, tropical notes, citrus, lemon and pine. Taste is really smooth and creamy with loads of juicy tropical fruits, grass, citrus and mandarin notes. Finish is smooth, hoppy and juicy fruity. Tasty. Easy to drink and juicy. Earlier Rating: 8/23/2015 Total Score: 3.7Draught @ Whole Foods 7th Ave Pub, San Diego, CA 

Pours orange with a smooth head. Aroma of tropical fruits, citrus, grass, pine and grapefruit. Taste is smooth, sweetish and juicy fruity with hints of malts, tropical notes, grass and pine. Finish is smooth, sweetish and juicy fruity with some hops and citrus. Okay.

Tap @ Karl Strauss, La Jolla.
Pours golden color with a large creamy head. Very fruity aroma, tropical, resinous hops and caramel. Tropical fruit sweetness on the flavor, resinous hops and some juicy notes. Quaffable, very good. 
4415Earlier Rating: 8/23/2015 Total Score: 3.8Tap @ 7th Ave Pub, San Diego.
Pours clear golden color with a small head. Sweet tropical fruits on the nose, floral hops and caramel, pine too. Resinous hoppy flavor, oranges, pine and pale malts. Tasty.
4515

Cask @ Karl Strauss, La Jolla. Aroma has tropical fruits, fruit candy and pineapples. Flavour has minerals, tropical fruits, spme grapefruit and mild nettles. Smooth and easy to drink.Earlier Rating: 8/30/2015 Total Score: 3.8Draught @ Karl Strauss, La Jolla. Aroma has tropical fruits and pineapples. Flavour has pineapple juice, tropical fruits and mild biscuity tones. Very juicy, refreshing and easy to drink. Mosaic is a great hop.

Cask @ Karl Strauss Brewing Co (La Jolla), San Diego, CA. Pours a cloudy yellow colour with a firm creamy head. Aroma of really fresh citrus, orange pith, smooth biscuit and grass. Flavour of really crisp juicy bitterness, orange pith, mandarin orange sweetness, a bit of tart-ish notes and biscuit. Medium bodied and velvety mouthfeel. Super drinkable. Great.Earlier Rating: 8/23/2015 Total Score: 3.6Draught @ the 7th Ave Pub, San Diego, CA. Pours a bright golden colour with a small foamy head. Nice lacing. Aroma of fresh herbal hops, mild graininess and orange pith. Flavour of crisp juicy herbal hops, orange pith, a bit of maltiness and lemon. Light bodied. Nice, juicy, dry finish. Good stuff.
33 cl bottle @ home. Pours clear golden with a white head that leaves a little lacing. Aroma and flavour are tropical fruit, citrus, and caramel - with a slightly bitter finish.

20.08.2015, tap @ BrewDog Barcelona:
The last small sample from the keg. Nice slightly bubbly mediumlasting head. Aroma is slightly dry foresty, pine needles, moss, leafs, hops, hay, lawn, citrus peel, light malts. Taste is slightly dry foresty, moss, leafs, pine needles, paper, hay, weeds, lawn, bark, citrus peel, light malts, hops. Medium bitterness, slightly dry mouthfeel. Nice.
Its another session IPA. What else can I say. Hoppy? yes. Amazing? Not really.

Sample at the Tehachapi Beer & Wine Festival on 07/18/2015: Clear straw-gold color with a medium white head that evaporates quickly to an outer ring. Short strings of lacing. Citrus, hops and malt in the nose. Light-bodied with flavors of grassy hops, citrus and biscuit malt. The finish is mildly bitter with a citrusy hops aftertaste. Above average overall.
Bottle bought at Geers. Danky, bitter, fruity, fantastic taste for such low ABV. I would like crates of this.
Bottle, bbotmc. clear gold with a big white head. Aroma of grapefruit and a hint of spiciness. Tastes fresh, bitter and citrusy. Medium body, lots of fizz, long grapefruit bitterness finish. Fun!
A little weak aroma of grapefruit. The taste is much better. Grapefruit, spicy. A little sourness from the wheat.

Bottle from Stone in Asagaya. Pours a crystal clear pale gold with a nice soapy white head that leaves good lacing throughout. Passion fruit, mango and papaya aromas come through strong with some light grass and grapefruit notes...slight bit of cat piss as it warms too. Nice citrus and tropical fruit on flavors with good bitterness on the palate. Not really a session at 5.5% ABV but still a great pale ale. Crisp and refreshing finish.
Poured nice clear amber, bit of foam. Fruity but not too sweet aroma, very refreshing, full of tropical fruits, mango and strawberries - and not cloying. Truly enjoyable and top notch.

Bottle.
APPEARANCE: clear blond beer, small stable white head.
NOSE: hoppy, fruity, pine, fresh, mosaic.
TASTE: very refreshing, smooth start, somewhat hoppy and bitter, but bit to sweet in the aftertaste for me. Bit too much tropical fruit in general. But a very nice one!
Dorado limpio y espuma blanca compacta. Aromas de pomelo, lima y pino. Cuerpo bajo, sabor intenso de pomelo y pino con final de amargor suave. Muy fresca y bebible.
Bottle from Biercab Shop. Golden colour with white head. Fruity, peach, grape aroma. Sweet, peach, grape, resinous, bitter taste. Medium body.
Ampolla, 5titius Olot. Color daurat clar, bon aroma afruitat, tocs cítrics daranja i raïm.
Pours golden with a nice head, aroma of peach, pineapple, flavor of peach, pineapple, grass,  pretty dry, medium bodied.
Clear gold. Citrus and tropical fruits with candied sweetness too. Mosaic makes a grey session IPA hop. Clean and citrus with needing the malt backbone.
On tap at Islands, served in frosted mug. Very light and clear with a foamy white head. Crisp aroma of grapefruit. Not much falvor or complexity. One dimensional.
Almost clear gold with a huge head. Aroma of papaya, melon, and tropical fruit salad, absolutely amazing. Taste very fruity, light, and damn good. Great beer.

UPDATED: AUG 6, 2015 Bottle shared at a tasting at Stass place. Better Beer Of The Month Club. Hazy yellow with a white head. Amazing aroma full of juicy tropical fruits. Flavor is full of fruity hops, tropical and citric, with moderate bitterness. Rather light-bodied. Really delicious!
Bottle. Amber beer with a cream head. Grapefruit aroma. Grapefruit and light over-ripe fruit flavor. Medium bodied. Grapefruit and light summer fruit lingers.

Poured into a shaker glass. Golden straw color with an off white head. This looks like the fizzy yellow beer Stone brewing talks about... Aroma is all hops with lots of citrusy notes and some pine - smells great. Flavor is pale malt with mostly grapefruit hop notes. Body seems really light, even for a session beer, and carbonation is lower than I expected. Maybe its my lupulin threshold shift talking, but Id like to see this a touch hoppier, even being a session IPA.

Now THIS is a GREAT session beer, KIRIN! For those of you not from/ living in Japan...forgive me, but Im sick of the mediocre "beer" here in the land of the rising ton(of SHIT). This gorgeous session kills! GREAT every time Ive had it...on tap and/or bottle. I gladly over pay for this over ripe fruit juice. Put down your glass of watered down actimalt and seek this out....NOW...seriously...GO!!! #GOODSHIT!

Pours straw colored and slightly hazy with no head. Aroma is hoppy with rubbery pine citrus. Flavor is in rounded bitters with tangy and sweet citrus. Fantastic hop flavor.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aromas ligeros a notas cítricas, principalmente naranja. 

Color dorado brillante y filtrada. Carbonatacion media, Corona de espuma media de baja retención. 

En boca amargor medio (45 Ibu).

Al paladar refrescante y equilibrada.

12 oz. bottle. It pours a nice clear golden orange color with a large fluffy white head that lasts. The aroma is fresh and potent with grass, pine, trooical fruit and citrus zest. Really great. The flavor is the same. Pale malty grains with a small hint of light caramel and big mango, blueberry, grass and grapefruit hoppiness. Very dry with a medium spiced hop bitterness in the finish. Definitely the best beer Ive had from Karl. Well done, and a great showcase for the Mosaic.

Crazy-bright citrus aroma -- lime peel, lemon juice, a little currant. Sunflower-gold with a fluffy white head. Flavor is what I like out of a session IPA -- decent bitterness, a soft crackery malt character, a bit of orange peel. The bodys soft and evacuated the palate between sips. Very refreshing.

Light golden color. Huge tropical fruit nose, papaya, mango pineapples. Moderately sweet with some phenolics. Slightly astringent but it all works with a little bitter finish. Great summer beer and Uber quaffable.
Great session IPA - poured from 12oz bottle on boat in San Diego. Peach, Orange and smooth. Mild hops and bitterness. Tasty
Damn good and straightforward single Mosaic IPA here. Loving the fact that these are cropping up all over the place.

Pours dark amber that is moderately filtered with half a finger of white foam. 

The nose shows a lot of big notes of citric pineapple, dry mango, hints of guava, cannabis, and malt. Not very intense, but the notes are pronounced and mix very well together. 

The palate shows a lot of the same. Balanced yet fruit forward with the same flavors as shown on the nose with a lingering tropical fruit background showing throughout the beer and strong malt backbone that supports the entire beer. The finish also shows a very slight IPA bitterness at the end. Medium bodied and also highly carbonated. Hands down, this has taken the place of my favorite session ale.
On tap at Young & Jacksons 200515. Not sure if this is a session ale as it seems to be quite a big beer. Deep amber to red colour with a big malt backbone. Very enjoyable.

[ Keg ][ 4oz ][ Karl Strauss Carlsbad ][ $1.50 ][ Mini Weizen ][ 5.26.15 ]
>> Clear straw pour, good white lace. Great aroma, sour seedy passion fruit, fresh. Clean, bitter flavor, passion fruit, dry finish, light mouthfeel, simple flavors. Refreshing. Slight mealy. as it warms... Slight chemical bite, bitter orange rind, best of the bunch though from what was sampled today.
Bottle at AA. Orange-gold with lace. Dank, citrus nose, grapefruit, apricot, light biscuit. Sweet and dank, very fruity flavor, almost estery. ight, crisp, ok finish. A bit boring but decent.
Bomber at Petco Park - solid sessionable hop bomb. Not much fruit on the nose but a little citrus on the taste. Plenty of white lacing.

Bottle from Sprouts: Poured a hazy golden liquid topped with a frothy thick layer of foam head. Aroma is fragrant with a fruity hop profile that would make any IPA lover salivate. The palate is delicate with only a minor notice of fizz across my tongue. Flavor is bitter with a big bite of green acidic hops signature to the mosaic hop. Notes of citrus peel, sweet onion, and a squeeze of grapefruit juice.

From bottle into pint glass. Pours yellow clear with just a bit of haze, large frothy white head. Stone fruit, lemon, oranges, grapefruit. Light body, medium carbonation, light sweetness, mild bitterness. Easy to drink, a tiny bit sweet otherwise, really good session ale.

I really like session beers. It seems the alcohol was on the upper side of being a session beer. The beer was very well balanced for me. Lots of citrus and just the right of bitterness to go with my sushi oriented dinner. I felt like I could have drank a six pack without getting tired of the taste. However, I did have to drive so limit was 2

95/97 seems a bit high to me as Ive yet to have a KS beer Id put that high, but this was solid. Higher end of the session ale spectrum for abv, average body, but a nice fruit forward (tropical) aroma and flavor. light to moderate bitterness. I do love Mosaic hops.
Tap, gold pour, white head, nose is citrus, taste is oranges, lemons, hops, bitter, pretty good session
Draft at The Lab near USC. Slightly hazy pale yellow pour with a slight white head. Massive tropical fruit nose. Very low bitterness in the taste - nice mango and kiwi fruit hops. Quite excellent.

Type: Draft
Glass: 10-oz. skinny glass
From: West Coast Barbeque & Brew in La Mesa (San Diego), Calif.
Price: $3.25
Purchased: March 27, 2015
Consumed: March 27, 2015
Misc.: N/A

Poured a golden, pale, clear color with 1-to-2 fingers of white, rocky head when I got it. Some bubble streams coming up from the bottom of the glass. Nice looking layered, foamy lacing. Below average retention. (Sight - 4.00)

Smelled Mosaic, Citra, spicy Simcoe, light grapefruit, tropical, light mango, peach and pineapple. (Smell - 4.25)

The taste wasnt quite as good as the nose. Got tropical, Mosaic, grapefruit juice, Citra, pineapple, light mango and floral (wishful?). (Taste - 3.75)

Light body. Thin-to-oily texture. Average carbonation. Abrupt, bitter finish. This grew on me somewhat as it went down. (Feel - 4.00)

Not a bad session IPA. Id have it again for sure. (Overall - 3.88)

3.91 88 B+

on tap at karl atraus la jolla. Pour looks golden yellow and has little carbonation to see and only a little head around the rim. aroma is light and fruity. Taste is slight bitter, mellow, light, little malt, light citrus. This should be what a light beer tastws like. excellemt flavor and nit heavy.

Ok. Ive had this 4 times now. 3 of which, it was one of the best beers Ive ever had. The other time, it was about a week older, and it was still very good. I live in San Diego county, and over half of the beers I drink are session IPA style beers. This stuff is as good as it gets. And Ive never had another Karl Strauss beer that I thought much of. Not trying to knock Karl Strauss. I havent had much of their beer. But, my go to breweries are Alpine, Societe, Ballast Point, Modern Times, Russian River, and Pizza Port. And this Karl Strass Mosaic is on par with my other favorite breweries.
Lightly cloudy with th I n white head. Nice aroma of mango and peach. Decent body for a session ipa. Which i dont like much. But this is ok.

Draft at the brewery. Pours Almost clear amber with a fizzy white head. Tastes like hop resin, grapefruit, dry malt, caramel, smooth booze. Light body and low carbonation. Smells like grapefruit, hop resin, caramel, and smooth alcohol

Tap at 4S. Pours clear gold with fizzy, white head. Aroma is citrus and tropical fruits, subtle malt notes, floral notes, and very faint dank. Flavor is hoppy throughout with good citrus esters, light sweetness, and faint pine; dry finish. Medium body and carbonation.

Tap at Karl Strauss - 4S Ranch. Pours clear pale gold with a small, fizzy white head, short retention with light lacing. Aroma is fragrant tangerines, orange, and lemon hops and crisp pale malt. Flavor is moderate citrus hops and medium bitterness, light malt and a dry finish. Light body and moderate carbonation.
Pours a golden amber color with a nice head. Aroma is floral with wild flowers and some melon. There is some sweetness like berries and sweet malts. Easy drinking beer, very tasty.
On tap at Harrys Hofbrau. Strong grapefruit and tropical hop aroma. Clear orange with full billowing white head. Taste is moderate citrus. Thin, watery mouthfeel. Quick dry finish.

Poured up on tap at the Temecula location where it exhibits a clear deep gold body that supports a nice looking tight off white head. The aroma offers up inviting pineapple and mango tropical fruit notes as well as some cantaloupe. The taste starts surprisingly soft on the palate. It quickly gets into bitter hops that seem floral and then lime mixed with grapefruit. To midway more and more tropical fruity mango notes surface amid some thin yet firm resiny pine hops.. This is a solid Session IPA.
Damn this is good - drinks as good as most big WCIPAs. Lots of Tropical fruit and pine, light, muscular body. Dry finish. Excellent.

UPDATED: DEC 25, 2015 Enticing citrus pine aroma in a gold pour.  Refreshing hop forward balance is sustained through the body and finish.  A perfect laid back brew that allows one to have a few in safety.

Pours a cloudy yellow color with a strong fruit especially grapefruit aroma. Taste is of hops and fruit mixed to leave a slight bitter aftertaste. A hint of grass in the flavor, that lingers for a little bit after the swallow. A good session I enjoyed at the restaurant in San Diego Sorrento Mesa.
Full bodied citrus aroma. A bit cloudy, golden color. Flavor of pine, and citrus with a grapefruit finish.

Appearance was cloudy yellow gold with diminishing white 1/2 finger head, spotty lacing. Aromas are soft grapefruit, pine, melon and lemon with hints of seed pale malt. Taste are fruits of grapefruit, lemon, mango and pine with slight sweet malts. Palate was smooth creamy soft CO2 with light thin body, then lasting fruity, piney balanced finish. A wonderful session, try it.

16 oz sample on tap at The Davis Beer Shoppe. The aroma is quite hoppy with pine, grapefruit, and mango. Really nice. Virtually transparent golden body with a nice white head and good lacing. Starts with some citrus hop flavors (lemon), becomes a little sweet in the middle. Finishes with a fresh moderately bitter grassy hop flavor. Nice. A little big for a session IPA, though.

On tap at the brewpub.

Appearance: lightly hazy golden color with a fine white head that leaves plenty of sticky lacing. 

Aroma: fruity Mosaic hops with faint baked bread. 

Flavor: moderately strong Mosaic hops with a faint, light malt background. 

Feel: light body wih crisp, medium carbonation. 

O: strongly flavored, well-crafted session IPA.

Despite my inclination to support the local San Diego beer scene, Ive never been a big Strauss fan--nor, for that matter, do I gravitate toward the bitter Stone bombers. However, when I was offered a free tap sample of Herr Karls homage to the Mosaic hop, I was won over big-time, wowed, as it were, by the intensely aromatic spice that isnt bowled over by intrusive IBUs.
Brought home a growler from the 4-S Ranch location and am drinking it as we speak. Very nice, and sessionable indeed--the best beer these guys have ever made.
Gold pour with a white head at Saucy Mamas in Big Bear. This is really a nice beer. Great hop essence, melons, peaches, papaya, citrus, light malt. Really refreshing. Really good.

Tapped at Karl Strauss at the Universal Studios in Los Angeles. Very fruity aroma and a lot of yeast plus a lot of fresh hops. Hazy golden color. Very refreshing and fruity and hoppy taste. Overall a very refreshing and tasty beer.
sample at GLBN Global Warming. decent IPA, grapefruit & tropical hop flavor, malty backbone. nice showcase of Mosaic
On tap at Capitol Beer & Tap Room. Pours pours blonde with a nice off-white head and an earthy aroma. There is a medium-bodied pale malt flavor with a notable mosaic finish.

On tap at brewery. This is a huge butt puckering grapefruit and tropical fruit bomb. Almost too much. However, great aroma and a nice bitter finish. Amazed it's a session IPA (5.5%), which is nice.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Beautiful citrus grapefruit hop aroma, taste follows that with a nice amount of malt to balance. Full flavored but refreshing. Great session ipa. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

The Mosaic Hops definitely come through in the aroma with tropical fruit and citrus notes. The appearance is light straw, and clear. Overall, Mosaic Session Ale is extremely drinkable, and flavorful session IPA.
A really nice aroma and taste to start here. Nice showcase for the hop. The flavor and aroma fade however as the beer warms up and becomes more middle of the road. Good hit of bitterness here.

On tap at the brew outlet on Columbia St, San Diego on 18th March 2014. The serving lady told me it was a wheat pale ale brewed on-site, I assume this is the same beer? Anyway I tried it. Slight haze to the golden look, white unlasting head. The Mosaic hops along with the wheat and other malts marry together neatly and produce a pleasant if slightly bland combination of aromas and tastes. Refreshing more than testing or exciting.

Appearance: Bright golden color with with a beautiful, tight bubble head. It just looks good.

Smell: I get a lot of sweet citrus and a touch of sharp hops in the nose.

Taste: This beer hits my tongue with refreshing orange and grapefruit-ish notes and finishes with some hop crispness. 

Mouthfeel: Light bodied.

Drinkability: Smooth. Easiest drinking beer Ive had this year. And tastiest too. Make Mine Mosaic.

The best beer brewed by KS this year! Aroma: slight earthy pine, big lemon/pineapple kick, and smells a lot like Citra, subtle herb smell. Appearance: subtle haze, light -pale- gold with great carbonation. Lightly Bitter. Taste: citrus, lemon, tropical, pineapple, slight piney, and clean!! Palate light body, abrupt finish. Overall, this beer is my favorite beer of the year and perfect for Summer days. Loading up on as many bombers as possible!

On Draught at Blind Lady Ale House. Great Mosaic hop aroma up front. Smells very tropical with stone fruit flavors add to the mix. Pours slightly cloudy, seems some wheat was used in the brewing process but contributes to nice mouthfeel. Tastes like a full bodied IPA but without the abv. Nice to be able to drink an IPA and not always feel it in your head. A great hoppy session. One of my new favorites!

Draught at Churchills Pub & Grille, San Marcos. Hazy pale golden/yellow beer with a small but lasting white head. Fruity pine apple aroma, mango, citrus, grapes, some peach. Hoppy floral creamy flavor, pine apples, mango, caramel, some biscuits. Surprisingly sweet but still hugely drinkable.

Tap at University of Beer in Davis, CA. Pours very, very hazy (opaque) wheat/gold with a creamy white head. Aroma of marvelous fruits. Near med body. Quite bitter with lots of tropical fruits followed by citrus. It is delicious.
Tap at brewery. This was the mosaic version. Incredible use of mosaic hops, very aromatic and flavorful but light and drinkable.

On cask @ Karl Strauss Costa Mesa. This is the Mosaic dry-hopped version. Hazy golden straw pour with a white head. Really nice fruit loops, grapefruit, pine, and pineapple. Some dough, a bit of bread, and plenty of orange. Quite assertive in terms of bitterness. Tons of pine and grapefruit peel. Slightly woods, big citrus, and a bit of pineapple sweetness. Not quite as fruity on the palate as on the nose, but still really solid.
